docs.snippet: U.S. stocks jumped to record highs Friday after a strong jobs report for the month of July gave investors more confidence that the economy is still growing. Financial and technology stocks soared and investors sold the safe assets they have favore...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. stocks jumped to record highs Friday after a strong jobs report for the month of July gave investors more confidence that the economy is still growing. Financial and technology stocks soared and investors sold the safe assets they have favored for most of this year.

headline.main: US Stocks Rise to Record Highs After Strong Jobs Report

docs.snippet: Political science research points to changes in income as being predictors of how people vote, and things were looking up in the July numbers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Political science research points to changes in income as being predictors of how people vote, and things were looking up in the July numbers.
docs.abstract: The Upshot;  strong July jobs report, following powerful June surge, is good news across board, with American workers earning 2.6 percent more over past year; positive economic results are likely to empower Democrats and Hillary Clinton and reshape debate on economy.

headline.main: This Is a Jobs Report That Democrats Can Boast About
headline.print_headline: A Jobs Report That Democrats Can Boast About

docs.snippet: There are no checks on a president’s power to wage nuclear war, though history suggests that there may be ways to slow down or derail the process....
docs.lead_paragraph: There are no checks on a president’s power to wage nuclear war, though history suggests that there may be ways to slow down or derail the process.
docs.abstract: Question of whether Donald Trump is fit to be in control of American nuclear arsenal, issue that Hillary Clinton has raised on campaign trail, has put spotlight on whether there are meaningful checks on presidential power to deploy nuclear weapons; while no one disputes president's ultimate authority, history suggests there are ways to slow down process in which nuclear strike decision is made.

headline.main: Debate Over Trump’s Fitness Raises Issue of Checks on Nuclear Power
headline.print_headline: Issue in Race: Can President Be Kept From Hitting Button?

byline.original: By WILLIAM J. BROAD and DAVID E. SANGER

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton shouldn’t give disaffected Republicans a less progressive agenda....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton shouldn’t give disaffected Republicans a less progressive agenda.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed article advises Hillary Clinton to refrain from drifting rightward in effort to attract Republicans disaffected by Donald J Trump's candidacy; argues her own proposals are sufficiently moderate, and asks why she would adopt more conservative policies that have failed.

docs.snippet: In focusing our reporting on occasional bursts of “actual violence” rather than the relentless stream of “mere vulgarity or racism,” were we missing the forest for the trees?...

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama confirmed on Thursday that Donald Trump will get national security briefings ahead of the November election, but he warned the Republican candidate, whom he has called "unfit" for office, that information from the meetings must be kept secret.

headline.main: Obama Warns Trump Not to Spread Details of Security Briefings
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns Trump Not to Spread Details of Security Briefings
